meanings.definition: A line or plane that divides something into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The bisector split the cake evenly between the two friends.
meanings.sent2: The bisector on the map showed the exact center of the park.
meanings.sent3: The bisector in the math problem was a superhero, ensuring fairness for all numbers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a bisector, bringing harmony to the room divided by tension.
meanings.sent5: The laser beam served as a precise bisector, cutting through the metal with accuracy.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that bisects something.
meanings.sent1: The diligent worker was the bisector of the project, ensuring tasks were evenly divided.
meanings.sent2: The sharp knife acted as the bisector, slicing the sandwich in half.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat saw itself as the bisector of the curtain, creating a secret passage.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a bisector, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun, with its rays spreading in all directions, was the ultimate bisector of light and shadow.
